diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute gangrenous cholecystitis with empyema of the gallbladder
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with right upper quadrant pain for the past 6 days, particularly worsening over the last day, alongside nausea. Clinical assessment revealed tenderness in the right upper quadrant and imaging indicative of ileus. The diagnosis of acute gangrenous cholecystitis was supported by these clinical and imaging findings.
